(top) Details of the interconnectivity of the Mo and Ni units (H atoms have been omitted) and (bottom) 2-D coordination network (the ligand LN4 is not depicted). Selected bond distances (Å): Ni1–S1, 2.593(2); Ni1–S4, 2.531(3); Ni2–S2, 2.574(3); Ni2–S7, 2.591(3); Ni3–S3, 3.142(3); Ni3–S8, 2.887(3); Mo1–N1, 2.124(7); Mo1–N2, 2.093(8); Mo1–N3, 2.081(8); Mo1–N4, 2.101(7); Mo2–N7, 2.125(8); Mo2–N8, 2.113(8). Selected bond angles (°): Ni1–S1–C1, 105.2(3); Ni2–S2–C2, 106.7(3); Ni3–S3–C3, 102.0(3); Ni1–S4–C4, 106.3(3); Ni3–S8–C8, 102.2(3); Mo1–N1–C1, 170.7(7); Mo1–N2–C2, 172.6(7); Mo1–N3–C3, 176.3(6); Mo1–N4–C4, 174.3(7); Mo2–N7–C7, 177.6(8); Mo2–N8–C8, 168.6(7). ORTEP plots and further geometric data can be found in ESI.†

elements.content: structure dataXRPDIRcrystallographic data‡ All syntheses were performed under a N2 atmosphere with the solvents and reagents degassed prior to use. Caution: perchlorate salts are involved in the preparation of 1 and 2. (NEt4)3[Mo(NCS)6]: Adapted from a described procedure.9 A solution of K3Mo(NCS)6 (9 mmol)23 in H2O was added to NEt4Cl (12.9 g, 77 mmol) in H2O (50 mL). A cream colored solid is formed. After 30 min of stirring, the suspension was filtered and the solid washed with H2O followed by EtOH (20 mL). The solid was then dissolved in MeCN (40 mL) and a solution of NEt4Cl (4.50 g, 27 mmol) in H2O (15 mL) added followed by further 50 mL of H2O. The solid was filtered, washed with H2O (20 mL) then with EtOH (20 mL) and Et2O and subsequently dried under vacuum yielding (NEt4)3[Mo(NCS)6] in almost quantitative yields (m = 7.47 g). FT-IR (ATR) ν (cm−1): 2981 (w), 2888 (w), 2044 (s), 1482 (m), 1451 (m), 1437 (m), 1392 (m), 1171 (m), 999 (m), 783 (m). Analysis calcd (found) for C30H60N9Mo1S6: C, 43.14 (43.06) H, 7.24 (7.48) N 15.09 (15.13)%. 1: A solution of (NEt4)3[Mo(NCS)6] (50 mg; 0.059 mmol) in CH3CN (10 mL) was carefully layered on the top of a solution of [NiLN4(H2O)2](ClO4)224 (49 mg; 0.088 mmol) in CH3CN (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). Black needles of 1 were collected after complete diffusion of the two layers (36 mg; 69%). These crystals were suitable for X-ray diffraction studies. FT-IR (ATR) νNCS (cm−1): 2106 (w), 2042 (s), see ESI.† Analysis calcd (found) for C57H66N24Mo2Ni3S12: C 37.21 (37.28) H 3.62 (3.50) N 18.27 (18.35)%. 2: preparation was similar to that of 1 with the exception that [CoLN4(H2O)2](ClO4)225 (50 mg; 0.088 mmol) was used. Very small black needles of 2 were collected after complete diffusion of the two layers (38 mg; 69%). FT-IR (ATR) νNCS (cm−1): 2107 (w), 2050 (s), see ESI.† Analysis calcd (found) for C57H66N24Mo2Co3S12: C 37.19 (36.92), H 3.61 (3.46), N 18.26 (18.03)%.

‡ All syntheses were performed under a N2 atmosphere with the solvents and reagents degassed prior to use. Caution: perchlorate salts are involved in the preparation of 1 and 2. (NEt4)3[Mo(NCS)6]: Adapted from a described procedure.9 A solution of K3Mo(NCS)6 (9 mmol)23 in H2O was added to NEt4Cl (12.9 g, 77 mmol) in H2O (50 mL). A cream colored solid is formed. After 30 min of stirring, the suspension was filtered and the solid washed with H2O followed by EtOH (20 mL). The solid was then dissolved in MeCN (40 mL) and a solution of NEt4Cl (4.50 g, 27 mmol) in H2O (15 mL) added followed by further 50 mL of H2O. The solid was filtered, washed with H2O (20 mL) then with EtOH (20 mL) and Et2O and subsequently dried under vacuum yielding (NEt4)3[Mo(NCS)6] in almost quantitative yields (m = 7.47 g). FT-IR (ATR) ν (cm-1): 2981 (w), 2888 (w), 2044 (s), 1482 (m), 1451 (m), 1437 (m), 1392 (m), 1171 (m), 999 (m), 783 (m). Analysis calcd (found) for C30H60N9Mo1S6: C, 43.14 (43.06) H, 7.24 (7.48) N 15.09 (15.13)%. 1: A solution of (NEt4)3[Mo(NCS)6] (50 mg; 0.059 mmol) in CH3CN (10 mL) was carefully layered on the top of a solution of [NiLN4(H2O)2](ClO4)224 (49 mg; 0.088 mmol) in CH3CN (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). FT-IR (ATR) νNCS (cm-1): 2106 (w), 2042 (s), see ESI.† Analysis calcd (found) for C57H66N24Mo2Ni3S12: C 37.21 (37.28) H 3.62 (3.50) N 18.27 (18.35)%. 2: preparation was similar to that of 1 with the exception that [CoLN4(H2O)2](ClO4)225 (50 mg; 0.088 mmol) was used. Very small black needles of 2 were collected after complete diffusion of the two layers (38 mg; 69%). FT-IR (ATR) νNCS (cm-1): 2107 (w), 2050 (s), see ESI.† Analysis calcd (found) for C57H66N24Mo2Co3S12: C 37.19 (36.92), H 3.61 (3.46), N 18.26 (18.03)%.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 1 Crystal structure of 1. (top) Details of the interconnectivity of the Mo and Ni units (H atoms have been omitted) and (bottom) 2-D coordination network (the ligand LN4 is not depicted). Selected bond distances (Å): Ni1–S1, 2.593(2); Ni1–S4, 2.531(3); Ni2–S2, 2.574(3); Ni2–S7, 2.591(3); Ni3–S3, 3.142(3); Ni3–S8, 2.887(3); Mo1–N1, 2.124(7); Mo1–N2, 2.093(8); Mo1–N3, 2.081(8); Mo1–N4, 2.101(7); Mo2–N7, 2.125(8); Mo2–N8, 2.113(8). Selected bond angles (°): Ni1–S1–C1, 105.2(3); Ni2–S2–C2, 106.7(3); Ni3–S3–C3, 102.0(3); Ni1–S4–C4, 106.3(3); Ni3–S8–C8, 102.2(3); Mo1–N1–C1, 170.7(7); Mo1–N2–C2, 172.6(7); Mo1–N3–C3, 176.3(6); Mo1–N4–C4, 174.3(7); Mo2–N7–C7, 177.6(8); Mo2–N8–C8, 168.6(7). ORTEP plots and further geometric data can be found in ESI.†

cln_elements.content: Fig. 3 Temperature dependence of χMT for [Co3Mo2], 2. (inset) View of the 50–300 K temperature range showing the minimum exhibited by χMT.
